text: And so ends my Top 10 for 2012. A big lack of Nintendo and handheld games, but that's mostly because the ones I played were from other years. I guess for me, this was a big year for Indie and PC games.
author: SupraDarky

text: I'm all about the Brute, a heavy class that can cause havoc inside the bases (to defend or to attack). But I,d say 80% of the time, I'm inside the Beowulf tank shooting everything in sight. Very hard to master which is why barely anyone uses it. The one thing that's disappointing about TA is the soundtrack, which I thought was awesome in Tribes 2. They abandoned the rocking music and went for more of an epic feel. This theme is easily the best and most memorable one.
author: SupraDarky

text: Well that was unexpected. I haven't been this addicted to a multiplayer shooter since Counter Strike and Tribes 2. I played this game way too much at the start of the year, took a break for Diablo 3 and Guild Wars 2, then came back to it. It's my go-to game whenever I want to get the blood pumping. I like it so much I even made a gameplay video. The learning scale is pretty much perfect, it can be very hard at first until you find the class, the weapons and the playstyle that fits you.
author: SupraDarky
